relation: Initial geographical center of the map.
Layers that will be added to the map initially.
Minimum zoom level of the map. Overrides any minZoom set on map layers.
Maximum zoom level of the map. This overrides any maxZoom set on map layers.

When this option is set, the map restricts the view to the given geographical bounds, bouncing the user back when he tries to pan outside the view. To set the restriction dynamically, use setMaxBounds method
Coordinate Reference System to use. Don't change this if you're not sure what it means.
pageTitle: Documentation - Leaflet - a JavaScript library for interactive maps

textAfterTable: Number null Minimum zoom level of the map. Overrides any minZoom set on map layers. maxZoom Number null Maximum zoom level of the map. This overrides any maxZoom set on map layers. maxBounds LatLngBounds null When this option is set, the map restricts the view to the given geographical bounds, bouncing the user back when he tries to pan outside the view. To set the restriction dynamically, use setMaxBounds method crs CRS L.CRS. EPSG3857 Coordinate Reference System to use. Don't change this if you're not sure what it means. Interaction Options Option Type Default Description dragging Boolean true Whether the map be draggable with mouse/touch or not. touchZoom Boolean true Whether the map can be zoomed by touch-dragging with two fingers. scrollWheelZoom Boolean true Whether the map can be zoomed by using the mouse wheel. If passed 'center', it will zoom to the center of the view regardless of where the mouse was. doubleClickZoom Boolean true Whether the map can be zoomed in by double clicking on it and zoomed out by double clicking while holding shift. If passed 'center', double-click zoom will zoom to the center of the view regardless of where the mouse was. boxZoom Boolean true Whether the map can be zoomed to a rectangular area specified by dragging
